instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no battery and no fan
threads.message:
Hello!, have a board which is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A and was after liquid damage. After cleaning and replacing corroded components board turns on, boots, but won't detect battery and fan at all. So far what I managed to measure:
PP3V42 - 3.42v
PPBUS-G3H with connected only battery is 11.04v
PPBUS-G3H on charger 12.25v
Resistor <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> - 2.0K
Resistor <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> - 2.0K
Resistor <RESISTOR>R5492</RESISTOR> is only 148K which should be 200K
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.37v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> 5.15v

Battery connector under the board was badly corroded (photo before) so can it be that SMC chip needs replacement due to short? Sorry, still pretty unexperienced, hungry for new info, thank you! :)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no battery and no fan
threads.message:
"PPBUS-G3H on charger 12.25v"
SMC doesn't talk with <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
I bet you have corrosion problem on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Check voltage and resistance to ground (diode mode) on these lines.
I recommend you remove and clean, or change directly battery connector.

BTW, recently similar case got 7V on SDA line, because of corroded connector.
That suppossed burning 3xISL6259 ...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no battery and no fan
threads.message: So, after replacing battery connector, <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and just after SMC reflow board detects and charges battery fine, but fan is still inactive and cpu reaches temp up to 90C, but on apple diagnostics at the end it spins. Thinking that SMC might be bad and needs replacement. If that would be case, could I reball and fit SMC from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A to my <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no battery and no fan
threads.message:
You need to take SMC from the same board.
Reball its SMC first.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no battery and no fan
threads.message: It's been a while with this device, but after doing some more tests just saw that macbook fan spins for one second then stops, after 6 seconds break starts again and stops and so on.. Any ideas guys? (in case just got my <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A donor board so will have plenty of components to spare)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no battery and no fan
threads.message:
On this board, fan doesn't start from the beginning.
It will spin later, when the CPU gets really hot...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no battery and no fan
threads.message: Haven?t mentioned that CPU reaches 90-95C while watching youtube in full screen, but as mentioned fan just spins for second and stops and then same again after few seconds. Temperatures not going down due to fan being ?lazy?. Did tests on same model, when CPU reaches temp between 80C fan kicks in and it cools to reach 40C, mine just tries to spin and stops :)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no battery and no fan
threads.message:
Install Macs Fan Control and manually set the fan for the CPU die.
Let see if fan stays spinning.
Did you try known good fan on this board?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no battery and no fan
threads.message:
New fan is fitted inside at the moment, before had original from this machine was acting same way, made video to show results (sorry for bad quality due to screen protector). 

[url]https://streamable.com/11qwl[/url]

[url]https://streamable.com/5gr0j[/url]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no battery and no fan
threads.message:
CPU Proximity temp appears to be less than 80 degrees.
Set Macs Fan Speed for CPU die, as both have high temperature.
If still bad, check <RESISTOR>R6061</RESISTOR>/64/65 and <TRANSISTOR>Q6060</TRANSISTOR>, as their solders and traces too.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no battery and no fan
threads.message: The fans don't spin on the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....at least till the system gets hot

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no battery and no fan
threads.message: Just run AHT and see if fan spins...takes 2 minutes.
